items.title: Japan PM to push US for tariff removal
items.summary:
- Japanese Prime Minister Ishiba Shigeru is negotiating with the US regarding tariffs that affect American industry.
- Concerns from motorbike and parts manufacturers were raised at a meeting in Kobe about the negative impacts of these tariffs.
- Japan aims to engage with US federal and state leaders to advocate for tariff removal and support industrial growth.
- The Japanese government plans to assist affected industries in collaboration with political parties based on input from manufacturers.
- Japan is the largest foreign direct investor in the US, with investments amounting to $783.3 billion, impacting nearly one million American jobs.
- Historical trade tensions between the US and Japan in the 1980s echo the current tariff situation, suggesting negotiations might be lengthy.
- The motorcycle industry highlights vulnerabilities from tariffs as essential material costs rise, stressing the need for appropriate support measures from the government.

items.title: A battered sector is making a comeback. What should you expect?
items.author: null
items.summary:
- Cryptocurrency and the Web3 industry are experiencing a resurgence after a period of decline.
- Institutional interest is growing, driven by developments such as Donald Trump's second presidential term and his support for bitcoin as a reserve asset.
- HTX Ventures is proactively investing in high-potential projects, predicting increased institutional involvement and the need for strong risk management in Web3.

items.title: Chinese authorities add 23 new genAI services to registry
items.summary:
- Chinese authorities have added 23 new generative AI services to their official registry.
- This move is part of a broader effort to regulate the rapidly growing AI industry in China.
- The additions signal the government's commitment to oversee and manage AI technologies effectively.

items.title: Silicon Valley divided as tech leaders back Trump
items.summary:
- Tech leaders in Silicon Valley express mixed reactions towards Donald Trump's policies and presidential campaign.
- Notable figures from the tech industry show support for Trump, creating a divide among peers.
- The political stance raises concerns and discussions regarding the future of technology and innovation in the region.

items.title: Data center race: Is Philippines falling behind in SEA?
items.summary:
- The demand for data centers in the Philippines is increasing due to advancements in ecommerce, fintech, and AI innovations.
- Southeast Asia's data center market is projected to reach US$18 billion by 2029, with a CAGR of 9.6% from 2023 to 2029.
- The Philippines is expected to have a higher growth rate of 13% CAGR but still lags behind Singapore, Malaysia, and Indonesia.
- The shift to cloud-based systems and digital transformation in the financial sector are key drivers for this demand.
- PLDT and Globe are the main players in the Philippines' data center space, with PLDT having the largest local facility footprint.

items.title: Canva launches AI-powered sheets to compete with Excel
items.summary:
- Canva introduced Canva Sheets, an AI-powered spreadsheet tool, at its product release event in Los Angeles.
- The tool automates tasks like data entry and report generation and includes features like instant language translation.
- Other features include Magic Charts for data visualization and Canva AI for content generation.
- Canva's Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) reached $3 billion, with 230 million monthly users, as it prepares for a potential US public listing.

items.title: Binance founder CZ denies allegations of plea deal evidence
items.summary:
- The Wall Street Journal reported CZ allegedly provided evidence against Justin Sun to US prosecutors as part of a plea deal, which CZ denies, calling it a potential smear campaign.
- Justin Sun supported CZ, describing him as a mentor and indicated his own cooperation with US prosecutors regarding USDT misuse.
- Reports suggest Binance executives lobbied the US Treasury to end oversight on anti-money laundering compliance.
- CZ denied seeking a pardon from President Trump, implying no felon would turn down such an opportunity.
- Recent cases show that plea deals lead to reduced penalties in crypto enforcement, with CZ receiving a four-month sentence despite prosecutors seeking three years, following a record $4.3 billion settlement by Binance with US regulators.
- Significant shifts in crypto regulation are occurring, with potential for exchanges to negotiate regulatory obligations as the Justice Department shifts focus from complex cases.

items.title: Indian tech stocks volatile due to tariff disputes
US to impose separate tariffs on exempted electronic products
Trump signals US tech tariff exemptions may be temporary
items.summary:
- Recently announced US exemptions on tariffs for smartphones, laptops, and semiconductors may not be permanent.
- President Trump stated that “nobody is getting off the hook” and emphasized the US will not be “held hostage” by countries like China.
- US tariffs on Chinese imports have reached 145%, while retaliatory tariffs from China stand at 125%.
- US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick indicated potential new tariffs on semiconductors and critical items could be announced in two months.
- The average effective US tariff rate is now at its highest since 1909, impacted by the China-US trade tensions.
- Economic analyses expect high tariffs to reduce GDP growth, increase consumer prices, and potentially cost households approximately $3,800.
- The trade conflict has allowed countries like Taiwan, Mexico, and the EU to gain market share due to trade diversion.
- Different nations adopt varied strategies towards US tariffs; China retaliates while Japan and Vietnam seek negotiations.

items.title: 50 rising AI startups in Asia
items.summary:
- A list of AI startups in Asia that have recently raised funding.
- Only includes companies up to the series E stage.
- Each entry provides key details about the respective funding round.

items.title: Change is in style at Love Bonito
items.author: Miguel Cordon
items.summary:
- Love Bonito, a Singapore-based fashion platform, expanded into more Southeast Asian markets in 2023.
- The brand underwent a refresh in 2024 and laid off 7% of its staff late last year.
- The company aims to achieve profitability within this year, with plans to inform the public regarding any developments.

items.title: 20 largest exits in Indonesia
GM to cut electric van production, about 500 jobs lost
items.summary:
- General Motors (GM) is reducing production of BrightDrop delivery vans at its CAMI assembly plant in Ontario, Canada, resulting in approximately 500 job losses.
- The plant will operate on a single shift and battery pack assembly will stop during the weeks of April 21 and April 28.
- GM cited market demand and inventory re-balancing as reasons for this decision, despite initial projections suggesting revenue targets of $1 billion for 2023.
- Only around 2,000 BrightDrop units were sold in two years, leading to criticism from the union about the impact on jobs.

items.title: US SEC, Binance seek 60-day extension in their legal dispute
items.summary:
- The SEC and Binance have filed for a 60-day extension to pause their legal dispute.
- The case has been on hold since February due to a stay approved by Judge Amy Berman Jackson.
- SEC's request emphasizes ongoing discussions for potential resolutions, with Binance supporting the move for judicial efficiency.
- A joint status report is expected to be filed in mid-June if the extension is granted.
- This pause reflects a shift in the SEC’s enforcement philosophy under new leadership, focusing more on collaboration with the crypto industry.

items.title: US Senate proposes bill to cut crypto, AI data emissions
items.summary:
- On April 11, 2025, Senate Democrats introduced the “Clean Cloud Act of 2025” to regulate emissions from crypto mining facilities and AI data centers.
- Sponsored by Senators Sheldon Whitehouse and John Fetterman, the bill targets facilities using non-renewable energy and aims to impose fines starting in 2035.
- The bill seeks to amend the Clean Air Act and applies to facilities with energy capacities over 100 kW.
- Regional emissions caps will take effect by the end of 2025, decreasing 11% annually until reaching zero in 2035.
- Facilities exceeding emissions caps face inflation-adjusted fines that cannot be passed on to customers.
- Collected fines will fund clean energy projects and help reduce residential electricity costs.
- Bitcoin mining consumes significant electricity, prompting regulatory action to address environmental challenges.
- The legislation reflects the uneven distribution of power generation and crypto mining operations across the U.S.
- A gradual 11% annual reduction acknowledges the current reliance on fossil fuels in bitcoin mining's energy mix.
- The bill aligns with broader climate concerns, targeting high-growth energy-intensive industries while balancing consumer protection.

items.title: China’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
items.summary:
- China has evolved from low-end manufacturing to high-tech innovation over the last decade.
- Companies like Alibaba and Tencent highlight the maturity of China's startup ecosystem.
- The article discusses the potential next big tech company in China and features a funding tracker.
- For more insights on top-funded tech companies in other regions, a link is provided.

items.title: KKR in talks to acquire post-trade services firm OSTTRA for $3b
items.summary:
- KKR & Co. is in advanced talks to acquire OSTTRA for around US$3 billion.
- OSTTRA is a joint venture between CME Group and S&P Global, offering services for foreign exchange and derivatives markets.
- Competitors in the bidding include GTCR, Advent International, and CVC Capital Partners.
- The deal is not yet finalized and may face delays or fail.
- The acquisition highlights financial infrastructure companies' attractiveness amid market uncertainty.
- Private equity firms are adjusting strategies to focus on businesses insulated from tariff impacts.
- The competitive bidding process reflects the premium value of market infrastructure assets today.

items.title: Japan won’t use US treasury holdings in tariff talks
items.summary:
- Japan will not use its US Treasury holdings as leverage in upcoming trade talks with the US on April 17.
- Policy chief Itsunori Onodera emphasized the need to avoid actions that could disrupt financial markets.
- Japan seeks an exemption from newly imposed US tariffs, which include a 24% tariff on Japanese goods and a 25% tariff on its auto industry.
- The US is requesting concessions on agricultural products and LNG.
- Japan's retreat from US Treasuries last week led to rising long-term yields, raising concerns about global reserve managers reconsidering US government debt.
- Japan's automotive industry faces a potential $24 billion cost due to tariffs, threatening its economic stability.

items.title: Chinese tech sector loses over $350b since March peak
items.summary:
- The Hang Seng Tech Index has lost over US$350 billion since its March peak.
- Despite losses, the index rebounded by more than 10% in the last four trading sessions.
- Geopolitical tensions, particularly US sanctions and financial restrictions, are raising investor concerns.
- Ecommerce firms like PDD Holdings (25% drop) and Alibaba (21% drop) are notably affected by tariff increases.
- Non-tariff actions, such as blacklisting of Tencent by the US Department of Defense, contribute to investor unease.
- Historical data suggests non-tariff measures have more significant market impacts than tariffs.

items.title: Taiwan to be prioritized for US tariff talks: President Lai
items.summary:
[Taiwan's President Lai announced prioritization for tariff talks with the US.]
[The discussions aim to enhance economic ties between Taiwan and the US.]
[Focus on trade resilience in response to global challenges.]

items.title: Alibaba’s Quark becomes top AI app in China
items.summary:
- As of March 2025, Alibaba's AI assistant app Quark is the most popular AI app in China, surpassing ByteDance's Doubao.
- Quark has nearly 150 million monthly active users (MAUs), while Doubao and DeepSeek have around 100 million and 77 million MAUs, respectively.
- Quark was originally a cloud storage service, now rebranded as a mobile and desktop AI assistant.
- It ranks sixth globally among AI apps in MAUs, following Baidu’s AI Search and OpenAI’s ChatGPT.
- China's initial AI investment strategy launched in 2017 is reflecting success, with Quark demonstrating the effectiveness of leveraging existing platforms for AI adoption.

items.title: Micron begins mass production of AI chips for Nvidia
items.summary:
- Micron Technology has started mass production of its fifth-generation HBM3E chips for Nvidia's Blackwell Ultra AI accelerator.
- Micron is the second supplier of HBM3E chips to Nvidia, following SK hynix.
- To enhance production, Micron will invest $7 billion in a new HBM facility in Singapore, operational by 2026, and convert existing facilities in Taiwan.
- Micron's global HBM market share stands at 5.1%, compared to SK hynix's 52.5% and Samsung's 42.4%. 
- The expansion is crucial to Micron's strategy to boost its production capacity in the HBM sector, amidst increasing semiconductor demands due to AI applications.
- The investment is part of a larger manufacturing expansion that also includes new production sites in Idaho, New York, and Japan.

items.title: Apple’s $22b iPhone production in India as it shifts from China
items.summary:
- Apple Inc. assembled iPhones worth US$22 billion in India during the fiscal year ending March 2025, a 60% increase from the previous year.
- 20% of iPhones are now produced in India, primarily at Foxconn’s facility, with support from Tata Group.
- India exported US$17.4 billion worth of iPhones, aided by government incentives aimed at making India a manufacturing hub.
- All iPhone models, including high-end variants, are now produced in India, although Apple still relies heavily on China for its supplier network.
- Apple’s manufacturing shift reflects a strategic diversification to mitigate geopolitical risks and enhance manufacturing efficiency.
- India’s growth as a production center involves significant government support and logistical improvements, leading to a 4-5% growth in its smartphone market in 2024.

items.title: China sets record with new EVs surpassing 50% market share
items.summary:
- In March 2025, new energy vehicles (NEVs) accounted for 51.1% of passenger car retail sales in China, marking a record high.
- This represents an increase of 8.7 percentage points from March 2024, highlighting sector growth.
- Domestic brands had a penetration rate of 72% for NEVs, while joint ventures only reached 6%.
- Factors influencing sales included government subsidies, spring campaigns, and new model launches like Xiaomi SU7 and BYD Qin L.
- Analysts project NEV penetration to remain above 50% through 2025, possibly reaching 70% by the end of the decade.
- China's long-term EV policies and increasing consumer interest are driving this trend.

items.title: EaseMyTrip allots $26.7m shares for healthtech, travel stakes
items.summary:
- EaseMyTrip’s board approved issuing 12.57 crore equity shares worth ₹229.03 crore (US$26.65 million) to various entities and individuals via preferential allotment.
- The allotment is part of a strategy to acquire stakes in new ventures, including Jeewani Hospitality, Rollins International, Pflege Home Health Care Center, and Planet Education.
- Collectively, the allottees will hold a 3.42% stake in the company as it expands into the charter aviation sector with a 49% stake in Big Charter Pvt Ltd.
- Despite expansion efforts, the company reported a 26% YoY drop in profit for Q3 FY25, alongside a 6% decline in revenue.
- EaseMyTrip’s diversification into healthcare and education aims to stabilize revenue amid declining travel bookings.
- The market responded positively, with shares rising 8.09% post-announcement.

items.title: Ex-Apple engineer joins blockchain with new startup
Abu Dhabi clean energy firm, ID state utility partner on solar
items.summary:
- Abu Dhabi Future Energy Company (Masdar) signed agreements with PT PLN (Persero) to develop floating solar energy in Indonesia.
- The first agreement is to build a floating solar power plant at Jatigede Dam, commencing this year and expected to finish by 2027.
- The second agreement involves expanding Cirata Floating Photovoltaic Power Plant, operational since November 2023, providing power to 50,000 homes annually.
- These projects aim to help Indonesia achieve net-zero emissions by 2050 and install 75GW of renewable energy by 2035.
- Masdar targets a 100GW clean energy capacity by 2030, enhancing collaboration with PLN.
- Indonesia's unique geography favors floating solar, addressing land constraints for traditional solar.
- The Cirata project not only generates power but also reduces evaporation and controls algae in reservoirs.
- Renewable generation reached only 14% versus a 23% target for 2025, indicating a gap in deployment.
- Strategic international partnerships are crucial for energy transitions in emerging markets, as demonstrated by the UAE-Indonesia collaboration.
- Indonesia faces challenges with a reliance on coal for electricity (60-67%) despite plans for a 100% renewable energy target by 2035.

items.title: He was a pioneer in streaming. Now he says AI will end pop stars
items.author: Ken Cheung
items.summary:
- Ken Cheung co-founded QQ Music in 2005, before Spotify, anticipating the future of music streaming.
- He warns that AI may end the era of megastars like Taylor Swift, as music production becomes accessible to anyone.
- Cheung discusses AI's disruption of the music industry in his interview with Tech in Asia, including China's tech evolution and needed founder restraint.

items.title: Indian travel tech firm Yatra appoints new interim CFO
items.summary:
- Yatra appointed Anuj Kumar Sethi as interim CFO following Rohan Mittal's resignation effective April 11.
- Mittal served nearly three years and oversaw Yatra's India IPO in September 2023 and a private funding round in late 2022.
- Sethi has been with Yatra for over a decade, previously served as principal financial officer, and has held the CFO position before.
- Yatra is preparing to announce its Q4 FY25 financial results after reporting a profit of 10 crore rupee (US$6.97 million) in Q3 FY25, an increase from 1.05 crore rupee (US$731,630) in the same quarter last year.

items.title: Japan to discuss tariff review with US officials in Washington
items.author: Akazawa Ryosei
items.summary:
- Japan's Economic Revitalization Minister Akazawa Ryosei will meet US officials this week to discuss tariffs from Trump's administration.
- Meetings include US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Trade Representative Jamieson Greer, starting April 16.
- Japan aims to review and potentially renegotiate these tariffs, emphasizing its investments in the US economy and agricultural product access.

items.title: Google Cloud expands support for startups in Australia, APAC
items.summary:
- Google Cloud is enhancing its support for early-stage startups in Australia and the APAC region.
- The initiative includes expanding local teams, strengthening partnerships with accelerators, and providing direct assistance to startups.
- Google Cloud plans to embed staff in key markets to build relationships with local startups.
- In 2024, Google Cloud launched its first AI accelerator and a new cohort for 2025 is confirmed, with applications open.
- The company aims to offer technical support including credits and customer engineering assistance.
- Google Cloud is prioritizing hiring locally to expand its presence and ecosystem programs.
- The strategy reflects a shift from AWS dominance in the startup space towards a hands-on engineering support model.

items.title: Tariff hike may slow Taiwanese electronic productions in Thailand
items.summary:
- Taiwanese PCB manufacturers may reduce production in Thailand due to a 37% tariff imposed by the US government.
- The tariff affects 14 Taiwanese firms in Thailand, such as Unimicron and Compeq.
- The tariff was announced on April 2 and included a 10% duty on US imports, with higher rates for countries with trade surpluses.
- Li Chang-ming stated it could deter further investments and lead Taiwanese firms to slow production for US-bound goods.
- Thailand's potential losses from these tariffs are estimated at 880 billion baht (around $26 billion).
- The changing tariff landscape complicates supply chain decisions for manufacturers, particularly PCB makers navigating uneven tariff protections.

items.title: Israeli-US AI beauty startup nets $17.5m seed funding
items.summary:
- Bliss Aesthetics has raised $17.5 million in seed funding to develop its AI-powered platform for cosmetic surgery.
- Fundraising led by Shine Capital, with support from Synchrony Ventures, Sheva Ventures, Point72 Ventures, and Cerca Partners.
- The platform uses generative AI and computer vision for realistic previews of surgical outcomes.
- Patients can choose board-certified surgeons and access financing options.
- Company operates in Israel and the US, with a team of 30 and a 500% expansion of its provider network.
- Addressing anticipated growth in medical aesthetics market, projected to surpass $200 billion globally in the next decade.

items.title: Australian cleantech startup RayGen bags $79.8m series D
items.summary:
- RayGen raised AU$127 million (US$79.86 million) in its Series D funding round, one of the largest clean energy tech investments in Australia.
- Key investors include SLB, ARENA, and Equinor Ventures, although full details remain undisclosed.
- CEO Richard Payne stated that the funding will help advance renewable technologies and support growth.
- This investment highlights the shift towards long-duration energy storage solutions amid a challenging funding landscape for clean energy.
- Australia is positioning itself as a clean energy technology exporter and aims to build domestic manufacturing capabilities for solar modules.

items.title: The hidden alliances between India’s VCs, uncovered
items.summary:
- Article discusses the co-investment patterns among venture capitalists (VCs) in India.
- It highlights hidden alliances where some firms frequently invest together while others avoid collaboration.
- A visualization mapping relationships among India's VCs based on deal data from the past two years is provided, aimed at assisting startup founders in fundraising.

items.title: Trump exempts smartphones, chips, other electronics from tariffs
Fresh face takes the lead this week
20 largest exits in India
Indonesia’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
items.summary:
- Indonesia's tech startup scene has produced unicorns like GoTo and Bukalapak.
- The startup ecosystem is rapidly growing, making it hard to track funding details.
- An automated tracker is available to monitor the latest funding developments.
- For feedback or inaccuracies, contact research@techinasia.com.

items.title: US VC firm Expert Dojo launches $100m fund for Indian startups
items.summary:
- Expert Dojo launches its third global fund with a target of US$100 million, allocating US$15 million for Indian startups in fiscal year 2026.
- The fund will focus on sectors including fintech, B2B, SaaS, and AI, with individual investments between US$50,000 and US$1 million.
- An additional US$30 million is planned for investment in Indian startups over the next 2-3 years, alongside the opening of a new office in Bengaluru.

items.title: AI action figure trend takes over LinkedIn
Binance said to seek removal of US oversight
US tariffs force Samsung to rethink Vietnam, its key hub
items.summary:
- Samsung produces around 60% of its 220 million annual phone sales in Vietnam, heavily relying on exports to the US.
- The Trump administration proposed a temporary 10% tariff on Vietnamese exports, potentially increasing to 22%-28%.
- Samsung is considering increasing production in India or South Korea to adapt to these tariff changes, which may incur significant costs.

items.title: SenseTime plans major computing power boost in 2 years
items.summary:
- SenseTime aims to increase computing capacity significantly over the next two years, targeting high double to triple-digit annual growth.
- Achieved a 92% increase in computing power in 2024, reaching over 23,000 petaflops.
- Focus on domestic chip integration to reduce dependence on foreign technology due to US-China tensions.
- Early investments in infrastructure have positioned SenseTime advantageously in the growing AI market, projected to expand from $391 billion to $1.81 trillion by 2030.

items.title: Alphabet, Nvidia invest in former OpenAI scientist’s startup
Ex-OpenAI employees back Musk’s lawsuit to keep nonprofit status
items.summary:
- Twelve former OpenAI employees support a lawsuit to maintain the organization’s nonprofit status led by Elon Musk.
- The lawsuit argues that a shift to control by investors could undermine OpenAI’s humanitarian mission.
- Former employees stress that the nonprofit structure is essential for attracting talent and guiding strategy, while OpenAI states the transition is necessary for attracting investment to fund growth.

items.title: A16z said to lead funding for ex-OpenAI CTO Murati’s AI firm
items.summary:
- Andreessen Horowitz is negotiating to lead a funding round for Thinking Machines Lab, founded by Mira Murati, former OpenAI CTO.
- The funding round could value Thinking Machines Lab at $10 billion, with potential funding nearing $2 billion.
- The startup, launched in February 2025, aims to create safer AI systems and currently has approximately 30 researchers, mainly ex-OpenAI members.
- Notable advisers include former OpenAI leaders Bob McGrew and Alec Radford.
- This represents a trend where former OpenAI employees are rapidly attracting significant investments for new ventures.
- In 2024, global AI funding surpassed $100 billion, demonstrating a shift in venture capital towards AI investments, focusing more on team credentials than traditional revenue metrics.
- OpenAI's internal restructuring has led to significant departures, causing both challenges and new competition from its former executives.

items.title: South Korea’s startup funding, as explained in charts
items.summary:
- The article explores recent trends in startup funding in South Korea.
- It is divided into two sections: a weekly update on investors and macro trends in funding data.
- The content is presented through charts and graphics, but access requires a subscription.

items.title: YouTube launches AI-powered music tool for creators
items.summary:
- YouTube launched an AI tool called "Music Assistant" to help creators generate instrumental tracks without copyright issues.
- Users can input prompts like "uplifting and motivational music for a workout montage" to receive generated track options.
- This initiative is part of YouTube's strategy to integrate AI music tools, following previous features like a music remixer for Shorts.
- The U.S. Copyright Office's stance on AI-generated works not being eligible for copyright creates a clear legal framework for YouTube's tool.
- Recent reports indicate YouTube is negotiating licensing agreements to ensure fair compensation when using artists' works.
- The Music Assistant aligns with a trend of democratizing music creation, making it accessible to non-musicians.
